cisc275.group3.sceneobject

Class ObjectHeron

  • java.lang.Object
    • cisc275.group3.sceneobject.SceneObject
      • cisc275.group3.sceneobject.ObjectHeron
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionMove, java.lang.Comparable<SceneObject>

    public class ObjectHeron
extends SceneObject
implements ActionMove
    Beta release mock-up for heron. Handles right-to-left and left-to-right moving heron via a boolean. If leftFish is true, fish moving left-to-right.

    BetaHeron.java

    Author:
    Jon

        public ObjectHeron(ObjectId id,
                   double x,
                   double y,
                   double sx,
                   double sy,
                   boolean land,
                   boolean hasland,
                   boolean lf)
        Creates a Beta Heron
        Parameters:
        id - ObjectID-heron's object id
        x - double-x-axis location
        y - double-y-axis location
        sx - double-speed on x-axis
        sy - double-speed on y-axis
        land - boolean-is the heron landed (not moving)
        hasland - boolean-has the heron landed ever
        lf - boolean-left moving heron

      • ObjectHeron

        public ObjectHeron(int d,
                   int h,
                   int id,
                   java.lang.String imFi,
                   java.lang.String n,
                   int w,
                   double x,
                   double y,
                   double sx,
                   double sy,
                   boolean land,
                   boolean hasland,
                   boolean lf)
        Creates a Beta heron as well as its ObjectID

        See ObjectId.java

        Parameters:
        d - int-depth
        h - int-object height
        id - int-(deprecated) object type
        imFi - String-Image file string
        n - String-name for object
        w - int-object width
        x - double-x-axis location
        y - double-y-axis location
        sx - double-speed on x-axis
        sy - double-speed on y-axis
        land - boolean-is the heron landed (not moving)
        hasland - boolean-has the heron landed ever
        lf - boolean-left moving heron

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Overridden from action interface.

        The move() first has three parts: 1) Is to determine if a flying (moving) heron should land (stop). This is set at a 13% chance or if it becomes too low in the view. 2) Is to determine if a landed heron should fly. This is set at 2% chance. 3) is to move all flying herons in the correct direction

        Specified by:
        move in interface ActionMove

      • getLeftHeron

        leftHeron returns if heron is moving left
